name: Platycodon
description: Platycodon grandiflorus, the sole species in the genus Platycodon, is a herbaceous perennial in the family Campanulaceae, native to East Asia.It is also known as the “Balloon Flower”, due to its balloon-like buds that burst open into large and beautiful blossoms. When fully opened, the flower closely resembles a star. It has a simple, but pretty blossom with five pointed petals that surround a star-like pistil. It attracts butterflies and is a magnet for birds.
meaning: The scientific name comes from the Greek words “platys”, which means “broad” and “kodon”, meaning “a bell”, in reference to the shape of the corolla. It is also known as “Balloon Flower” because of the balloon-shaped flower buds.
color_description: Platycodon come in purple, blue, pink and white.
